artifact.content: Login screen A screen in the console allowing the administrator to login
Exit Console Console screen has a button for exiting from the program
Logout Each screen in console should give administrator the option of logging out
Correct Login handling When user/pass are entered, the system is able to check that and display the right error messages
Back Administrator can return to the previous screen at any time by pressing back
User Management option Administrator can click on user management button to go to the screen that does user related tasks
System Management option Administrator can click on system management button to go to the screen that does system related tasks
New User Create a new user in system from the User Management screen
Search User Administrator can choose to search for users from the User Management screen
Open User Administrator can open a user from the search results screen
Edit User Administrator can edit any of the user fields and save changes afterward
Deactivate User Administrator can deactivate a user from the User Management screen. All accounts of the user are suspended.
New User Account Add a new account for an existing user from the User Management screen
Open User Account Administrator can open up a user account from the User Management screen
Edit User fields Administrator can edit all the fields from the User Management screen
Edit User Account fields Administrator can edit user account fields like IP address and phone # from the User Account Management screen
Correct Phone and IP addresses In User Account Management screen, system console fetches all available phone #s and IP Addresses
Choose Billing Plan Administrator can choose the right plan from the User Account Management screen
Suspend Account Administrator can suspend an account from the User account management screen. Status becomes suspended
Resume Account Administrator can resume an account from the User account management screen
Deactivate Account Administrator can deactivate an account from the User account management screen
Account status User management screen shows the updated status of all the accounts of the user. Status switches between suspended, active and inactive
Billing Plan option Administrator can click on billing plans button to go to the screen that does billing plans related tasks from System Management screen
New Billing Plan Administrator can start to create a new billing plan by clicking on �new plan� button
Select Billing Plan Administrator can select a billing plan from the list of plans in the Billing Plans screen. That plan�s details will show up in the screen.
Edit Billing Plan Administrator can edit any of the fields of the plan in the Billing Plan screen
Save Billing Plan Administrator can save the values of an edited or a new plan by clicking on the Save Plan button
Delete Billing Plan Administrator can delete the currently selected plan by clicking on the Delete Plan button
User Account synchronization When a Bill Plan is deleted, any user account using this billing plan reverts to the default billing plan (regular one)
Open Discount Administrator can open one of the plan�s discounts by using the open discount button. The discount shows up in the Discounts screen.
Edit Discount The fields of the opened discount can be edited by the administrator
New Discount Administrator can choose to create a new discount from the Discounts screen
Save Discount Administrator can choose to save the new discount or changes to the discount being edited
Delete Discount Administrator can choose to delete the currently selected discount
Enter View Bills Screen Administrator can enter the bills screen by clicking on the view bills button in the User Account Management screen
All Bills Listed Administrator can see and sort all of the bills of the service from Bills screen
Display Bills Administrator can display all the bills by clicking on �view bill detail� button
Print Bills Administrator can print a bill by clicking on issue bill button in bills screen
Pay Bill Administrator can pay part of the bill or the whole bill from the bill details screen
Override Bill details Administrator can manually change details of the bill
Correct bill override handling If bill modified incorrectly, the system will recognize and send error signals
System Maintenance option Administrator can click on system maintenance button to open the system maintenance screen from the system management screen
System Load The maximum and current system load are displayed in the system maintenance screen
Change Load Administrator can change the maximum load of the system
View System Logs Administrator can view system log of a previous date via the system maintenance screen
Add Phone to test Administrator can add a phone into the to be tested list
Phone details Both the phone number and IP address are displayed in the test list
Test All Administrator can select to test all of the active phones
Test/Not Test Administrator can unselect the phones that are not to be tested from the list
Test OnHook Administrator can choose to test OnHook of target phone(s)
Test OffHook Administrator can choose to test OffHook of target phone(s)
Test DigitPressed Administrator can choose to test DigitPressed of target phone(s)
Test DigitReleased Administrator can choose to test DigitReleased of target phone(s)
Test Results Test results can be seen in the system maintenance screen
Check Resource When the caller picks up the phone, system will check to see if the maximum load has been reached. If it has, the caller cannot make the call

Resource and phone status updated When a call is in progress, the system will update the status of caller and callee. System increments resource when a call is initialized and decrements when the call finishes.
Pick Up Tone When the caller picks up the phone, system sends the correct tone over to the phone
Inactive Phone If the caller is picking up an inactive phone, then there will be no dial tone and the caller would not be able to make the call
Phone lies off hook If 4 digits are not dialed and the phone is off the hook, then system will timeout and keep on sending ready tone until the phone is hung up
Dial 4 digits The system can pick up on the first 4 digits that the user is dialing when the phone is picked up
Ignore following digits If the user dials more digits afterward, the system will ignore the digits
Check privilege System checks to see if the caller can make this call and if callee can receive this call
Check dialed number System checks to see if the dialed number is active. If not, system will send the not active message to the caller phone
Check busy System checks to see if the dialed number is busy. If it is, system will send the busy tone to the caller phone
Callee unavailable If callee does not pick up the phone, then the system will eventually timeout and send busy ring tone to the caller
Start call log Once the other side picks up the phone, the system will start keeping a call log for billing purposes
Establish Connection Once the other side picks up the phone, the system will stop sending �ready� tone to caller side and establish connection between 2 sides
Audio signal relay Successfully encrypted audio signals sent between the 2 sides via TCP/IP protocol
One side hangs up Other side receives the �end call� tone from the system after one side hangs up.
Finish call log Once one side hangs up, the system will finish the call log, add it to the bill and recalculate the bill
Send ring tone If the callee is active and not busy, the system will send signal to start the ringer on the callee
Callee picks up The ringer will stop ringing on callee�s phone and the system will mark the callee as busy.
Get Time System will automatically poll the time of the clock of the server machine
Fast Connection Fast connection to other phone or quick return of busy signal
Availability The system is available most of the time
Security The calls must be secure
Friendly Interface The system console is very intuitive
Meaningful Feedback The phone feedback is meaningful
Audible Ringing The ringing has to be loud enough
Clear Reception Both sides have to be able to hear the other side easily
Minimal Delay of Calls Voice transmission must be very fast
Readability Bill statements must be readable
Advanced Warning of System Check System checks are announced to users well in advance
9 to 6 system support The system should always have a support person
Language Fluency Administrator is preferred to be fluent in different languages
Admin number Administrator number is easily be remembered
Testability System can easily be tested by the administrator
Maintainability System can easily be maintained
Extendability Ability to extend the system console
Migratible Can migrate easily between languages
Reliability System must be very reliable and does not crash often
Reusability Much of the code is being reused in different modules
Understandability Much of the code is commented and documented
